panels.description: The time that the job has been running without interruption.
panels.title: Current Uptime

panels.description:
Information in restarts:

* `Restarting Time`: The accumulated time it took to restart the job per interval (shown on left y-axis).
* `#Restarts`: The number of full restarts per interval (shown on right y-axis).

*Note:* If there are multiple jobs for this deployment, each job is shown separately. Alternatively, the first two (disabled) queries show aggregated results over all deployments.
panels.title: Restarts

panels.description: Failed Checkpoints within the chosen time range.
panels.title: Failed Checkpoints

panels.description: Completed Checkpoints within the chosen time range.
panels.title: Completed Checkpoints

panels.description:
Shows the 99th percentile of the custom histogram metric `eventTimeLag`.

The shown value is actually the maximum of all operators' subtasks' 99th percentile over all their reported 99th percentile values in the time range.
panels.title: Event Time Lag - 99% Quantile

panels.description: Shows for each operator the max of its subtasks' 99th percentile of the custom histogram metric `eventTimeLag`.
panels.title: Event Time Lag per Operator - 99% Quantile

panels.description: Shows for each subtask of the selected Task `$task` the 99th percentile of the custom histogram metric `eventTimeLag`.
panels.title: Event Time Lag per Subtask ($task) - 99% Quantile

panels.description:
Shows the latest reported output watermarks for each subtask of the selected Task `$task`. Since each subtask reports the watermark independently, you will see different processing time timestamps for each reported watermark. The order of appearances is arbitrary.

* `Invalid date` is likely caused by the watermark being `-infinity`.
panels.title: Output Watermark per Subtask ($task)

panels.description:
Shows the difference between the current processing time and the event time of all the subtasks of the selected Task `$task`.

*Note:* the processing time only has second-accuracy!
panels.title: Processing Time - Event Time ($task)

panels.description: Sum of all source subtasks' average output records per second in the time range.
panels.title: Source Throughput

panels.description:
For each task, sum of all its subtasks' output records per second.

Note that a sink does not expose this metric and is not shown.
panels.title: Records Out/Second per Task

panels.description: Detailed overview of the output records per second of all the subtasks of the selected Task `$task`.
panels.title: Records Out/Second per Subtask ($task)

panels.description:
Estimate of the amount of live data in bytes (usually smaller than `.sst` files size due to space amplification).

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Live Data

panels.description:
Monitor the number of background errors in RocksDB.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Background Errors

panels.description:
Monitor the current actual delayed write rate. 0 means no delay.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Delayed Write Rate

panels.description:
Estimated total number of bytes compaction needs to rewrite to get all levels down to under target size. Not valid for other compactions than level-based.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Pending Compaction Bytes

panels.description:
Monitor the number of currently running compactions.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Running Compactions

panels.description:
Track pending compactions in RocksDB. Returns `1` if a compaction is pending, `0` otherwise.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Pending Compactions

panels.description:
Track whether write has been stopped in RocksDB. Returns `1` if write has been stopped, `0` otherwise.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Write Stopped

panels.description:
Monitor the number of currently running flushes.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Running Flushes

panels.description:
Monitor the number of pending memtable flushes in RocksDB.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Pending Flushes

panels.description:
Monitor the memory size for the entries residing in block cache.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Block Cache Usage

panels.description:
Monitor the approximate size of the active, unflushed immutable, and pinned immutable memtables in bytes.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): MemTable Size

panels.description:
Monitor number of live versions. Version is an internal data structure. See RocksDB file `version_set.h` for details. More live versions often mean more `.sst` files are held from being deleted by iterators or unfinished compactions.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Live Versions

panels.description:
Monitor the memory size for the entries being pinned in block cache.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Block Cache Pinned Usage

panels.description:
Estimate the memory used for reading SST tables, excluding memory used in block cache (e.g., filter and index blocks) in bytes.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Readers Memory Used

panels.description:
Monitor the number of unreleased snapshots of the database.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Unreleased Snapshots

panels.description:
Monitor the total number of entries in the active memtable.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Num Entries (active memtable)

panels.description:
Monitor the total number of delete entries in the active memtable.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Num Deletes (active memtable)

panels.description:
Monitor the total number of entries in the unflushed immutable memtables.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Num Entries (immutable memtables)

panels.description:
Monitor the total number of delete entries in the unflushed immutable memtables.

The values shown here are the sum of all matching operators' state metrics per Task Manager.
panels.title: RocksDB($rocksdb_state): Num Deletes (immutable memtables)

panels.description:
The CPU use of each of the TaskManagers:
* Container CPU in % of total assigned CPU shares

targets.expr:
sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_taskmanager_Status_JVM_CPU_Load",deploymentId="$deploymentId"}) by (pod,tm_id)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_left()
  (
    rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{pod=~"job-.*-taskmanager-.*",container=~"flink-taskmanager"}[5m]) * 1024 * 100
    /
    on(pod,id)
    container_spec_cpu_shares{pod=~"job-.*-taskmanager-.*",container=~"flink-taskmanager"}
  )
) by (deploymentId,tm_id)

panels.title: Task Manager CPU Used (all TMs)

panels.description: Shows, per TM, the ratio of memory used vs. the configured limit (`container_memory_working_set_bytes / container_spec_memory_limit_bytes`).

targets.expr:
sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_taskmanager_Status_JVM_Memory_Heap_Committed",deploymentId="$deploymentId"}) by (pod,tm_id)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_left()
  sum (container_memory_working_set_bytes{name=""}) by (pod)
) by (tm_id)
/
sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_taskmanager_Status_JVM_Memory_Heap_Committed",deploymentId="$deploymentId"}) by (pod,tm_id)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_left()
  sum (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{name=""}) by (pod)
) by (tm_id)

panels.title: Task Manager Memory Used (all TMs)

targets.expr:
sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_taskmanager_Status_JVM_Memory_Heap_Committed",deploymentId="$deploymentId",tm_id=~"$tm_id"}) by (pod,tm_id)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_left()
  sum (container_memory_working_set_bytes{name=""}) by (pod)
) by (tm_id)

sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_taskmanager_Status_JVM_Memory_Heap_Committed",deploymentId="$deploymentId",tm_id=~"$tm_id"}) by (pod,tm_id)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_left()
  sum (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{name=""}) by (pod)
) by (tm_id)

panels.description:
The CPU use of the JobManager:
* Container CPU in % of total assigned CPU shares
* JVM Load (disabled by default): 1.0 = 1 CPU core

targets.expr:
sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_jobmanager_Status_JVM_CPU_Load",deploymentId="$deploymentId"}) by (pod)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_right()
  (
    rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{pod=~"job-.*-jobmanager-.*",container=~"flink-jobmanager"}[5m]) * 1024 * 100
    /
    on(pod,id)
    container_spec_cpu_shares{pod=~"job-.*-jobmanager-.*",container=~"flink-jobmanager"}
  )
) by (deploymentId)

panels.title: JobManager CPU Used

targets.expr:
sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_jobmanager_Status_JVM_Memory_Heap_Committed",deploymentId="$deploymentId"}) by (pod)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_right()
  sum (container_memory_working_set_bytes{name=""}) by (pod)
) by (deploymentId)

sum(
  0*max({__name__="flink_jobmanager_Status_JVM_Memory_Heap_Committed",deploymentId="$deploymentId"}) by (pod)
  +
  on(pod)
  group_right()
  sum (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{name=""}) by (pod)
) by (deploymentId)

list.description: Deployment Name of the selected Deployment ID
list.label: Deployment Name
list.name: deploymentName

list.description: Select a specific Flink Task to get more details about (task names depend on operator names given in your Flink job).
list.label: Task
list.name: task
